website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy, dependable Ethernet switch that works great for residential and commercial applications.
pros: Offers auto-negotiation capabilities for automatic connection at the highest-available speed
Ensures you can seamlessly connect to a modem without delay
Delivers low latency in comparison to similar switches
cons: Ports sometimes stop working over the course of several months

customer_reviews.title: Very good investment for a growing wired connection
customer_reviews.text: No fuss just plug it in give it some network and your off with no worries of running out of ports. Very good investment for a growing wired connection. I was getting tired of computers losing WiFi and non-wifi devices taking up all my ports. TV, Chromecast ultra, home security, several desktop fill a 4 Port WiFi router fast. I put this on and removed everything from my Asus and now everything is working great. Update - Out of the blue it's turned off and won't turn back on, 6 months after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Impact9

customer_reviews.title: Solid switch, disappointing quality control
customer_reviews.text: Solid switch, thoroughly tested 2.5G, 5G and 10G on the 10G side, very happy with overall functionality. Marvell-based switch, 88E6190X for the 1G ports, and 2x 88X3310P for the 10G ports. PCB is clean, only 1 electrolytic cap (power supply side), so it's likely to last forever. Why not 5 stars? The heatsink on top of the 10G chipsets was not seated properly, it was merely hovering (kudos to Marvell, their chip didn't turn to ashes despite the lack of proper cooling). Removed the stock thermal paste (was completely dry), replaced it with some Noctua NT-H2, and re-installed the heatsink properly. Disappointing quality control. Included some tech nudes, if that's what you're into.
customer_reviews.author: David G.

customer_reviews.title: This switch dies after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Had this product for 10 months, it stopped passing data even when the lights were blinking. No support from Netgear and they wanted me to pay more for a check up than a new switch costs. Last piece of Netgear I will ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: Willa

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised. But runs hot...very hot.
customer_reviews.text: I received this switch after speedy delivery. On plugging it to power socket, I got funky burning smell. Immediately the switch stopped working. Turned out that the adapter had burnt out. Had to go out and get a replacement adapter from local store for $3. Thankfully the switch is working as expected. So not cutting any stars. I get 10 Gbps link speed and transfer speed between QNAP TS-653B and my PC (Both having Aquantia AQC-107 10gbe PCIe cards) is 620 MBps (5 Gbps) download and 375 MBps (3 Gbps) upload. This is as per my expectations. Let's see how long it lasts. I am a bit worried because it runs very hot. Too hot to touch in-fact.
customer_reviews.author: Sanket

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and very powerful
customer_reviews.text: For security reasons I am not allowed to use wireless equipment at my home office. When I brought in a second computer to do some additional work, I discovered that my router didn't have enough ports, so I ordered the Netgear 8-port Gigabit Ethernet Unmanaged Switch (GS308v3). It's compact, inexpensive, easy to install, easy to set up and very powerful. I gives me the ability to wire all the devices I need to have on the same network, and the peace of mind to know it's going to be there for me.
customer_reviews.author: O. Banarie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent switch for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great switch. I've purchased many, many Netgear switches for small businesses and homes over the years. Bought this switch to replace and 8 port and a 4 port...cleaner installation and wiring. Have never had a failure. I find the negative reviews here to be curious -- wonder if they're using cheap patch cables -- I don't scrimp when it comes to cables. Or plastic switch models. I only buy metal. These switches simply work. Period. And the LED displays tell you clearly the connection speed per port. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MyOnlineOpinions

customer_reviews.title: WHY DOES NETGEAR PUT SWITCH LOCKOUTS ON IT ????
customer_reviews.text: the webpage for netgear / switch box setting is NOT USER FRIENDLY . I never found the options to change my netgear switch box setting . THE BOX HAS FOR PORTS FOR CONNECTING 4 DEVICE BUT NETGEAR HAS SWITCH LOCKOUTS FOR HOME USE . YOU WOULD BE LUCKY IF YOU CAN EVEN CONNECT 2 DEVICES TO THIS STUPID UNUSER FIRENLY SWITCH BOX . I HAVE TO UNPLUG ONE OF MY DEVICES IF I WANT TO WATCH FIRESTICK. AND IF I WANT TO PLAY MY PLAYSTION I HAVE TO UNPLUG THE DAMN FIRESTICK TO DO SO . NEVER BUYING NETGEAR SWITCHES AGAIN , YOU FAILED ME TWICE . YOUR WEBSITE IS TRASH AND YOUR SWITCH IS TRASH / FALSE ADVERTISEMENT
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect -- one potential dealbreaker
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this switch for about 2 years. It works flawlessly *except* for one gripe. When transferring lots of data for an extended period of time, the port that was handling that data basically stops working until you power cycle the switch. I found this out when copying my hard drive data over to my NAS. This resulted in ports dying every 30 minutes. Kind of a nuisance, but I tolerate it because huge data transfers are a rare occurrence for me. Be aware of this flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Nice, quiet switch.
customer_reviews.text: I got a few devices set up in my bedroom that use a internet connection. They all have wireless connectivity but with the router being far away behind a few walls, and with my bedroom door closed, the wifi signal gets weak, I get intermittent signals and dropped from the internet quite frequently. I ran a long cat5e cord from the router to my bedroom to help fix it. I got this switch for additional ports to connect all my devices. Works great and no more speed or disconnects from before. Easy to set up, plug and play and being fan less it is completely silent.
customer_reviews.author: Sn00py_009

customer_reviews.title: Bulletproof
customer_reviews.text: These Netgear switches are almost bulletproof! I've put several in to client's sites, and used a few for personal use. It's a classic metal design that feels solid, and these just work. In fact, the world will probably have moved on to 100Gb Ethernet before this thing stops working. Indeed, the only reason I bought two of these - one for home use, the other as a spare in my tool kit - was because of the lack of gigabit speed. I still have the original 10/100 model, bought in 2001, and it still works... just not at the speed I need!
customer_reviews.author: J. Cofer

customer_reviews.title: Sloppy Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: When I plugged cables into the top row, I realized that the faceplate is covering part of the port where the tab-lock should engage. It prevents the cable tab from holding the cable in the switch. I tried to reposition the faceplate and the ports behind them and wasn't really successful. For now, I'll try to use the bottom row. But as that gets filled, I may have to take a file to the faceplate. Overall, it's a mild irritation, but something that should be really easy to prevent during manufacturing. Otherwise, the switch works well, doesn't make any noise, and comes with everything needed for rack or desk mount options.
customer_reviews.author: RobotSpider

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have 1Gbps speed via xfinity and I am using their XB7 gateway. Unfortunately, these new gateways only have a few ports on the back of them. I have some devices that I need to hardwire and many that are wireless. This works perfectly for me and I have plenty of extra ports if I need to add additional devices. I tested my speed and did not see any degradation after adding this switch. I get very close (upper 900's) to 1Gbps speed using this switch. I placed the switch on top of a very tall bookshelf so only the side of it can be seen. I would recommend this if you only need an unmanaged switch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly the compact size I needed and at a great price. No issues with it after a few ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the compact size I needed and at a great price. No issues with it after a few months of use in a media panel. Now if they will only make a 10gbit model in this form factor..
customer_reviews.author: C. Brown

customer_reviews.title: doesn't divide mbps speed evenly
customer_reviews.text: according to Amazon, this switch is supposed to divide ethernet speed evenly among devices, but instead one computer got 75% of the speed while the other computer's speed became less than wifi speed - we get about 325mbps, and my wife got only 80mbps while I got 240 - she's like "you said this would give me more speed and instead it's giving me less - are you sure you know what you're doing?" since I'm always trying to get my wife to adopt new things when it comes to computers, this didn't make me look very good [:-{
customer_reviews.author: WTL

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: It's a gigabit switch. Inside there is just a single chip that makes it work. It's a very simple and efficient design. I have had trouble with some 4-wire industrial ethernet implementations working with it, this is not an industrial switch it is designed for home or light office use. That said it works like a good switch. You plug in the cables and you get data at the intended speed. If you have a modern cable modem that has just one or two ethernet ports on it, you need this. It's good value for the money and unlike plastic things that look disgusting after a few years, a wet rag restores this to it's original appearance.
customer_reviews.author: T. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Wireless is nice, but nothing beats wired connections for speed.
customer_reviews.text: While Wireless is coming a long way, it's still half-duplex and rarely will you get your full throughput. This might not seem like much, but if run your own server, like a NAS, you want that speed so file transfers don't take forever. Most of my house is wired for Cat6. With this switch nearly every room has a very nice high speed connection. I can stream to my TV with very little interruption and connectivity to my server is awesome. Do you *need* a gigE switch? Chances are if you've got more than 8 wired devices on your network, you do. Just don't cheap out and go with Cat6 or better wiring.
customer_reviews.author: TheElderGodFather

customer_reviews.title: DOA - Probably from shipping
customer_reviews.text: Arrived non-functional. When plugged in, the power LED lit but all the Ethernet ports were dead. I've been using small Netgear switches for years and have found them very reliable. I can't believe Netgear let this unit leave the factory dead. Amazon shipped my unit in its factory carton - not packed in a larger, secondary carton for more protection from shock. My guess is that rough handling during shipping damaged unit internally. Perhaps if Amazon double-boxed these units, more would arrive alive.
customer_reviews.author: Mars

customer_reviews.title: Plug and play....true gigabit performance
customer_reviews.text: I wired my home with CAT-5 10/100 BaseT, many years ago, so wifi is not a big issue for me. Hard-wired ethernet is always going to give better performance...its simply physics. I replaced a similar Netgear 10/100 16 port switch with this one after subscribing to AT&T Gigabit service. I also replaced three 5-port 10/100 Netgear switches with gigabit switches. All plug and play, and each will pass true Gigabit bandwidth. I get 960 to 980 Mbps at every wired computer. My NAS is a LOT quicker....
customer_reviews.author: rtinatl

customer_reviews.title: Failed in less than 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to believe all the talk of netgear switches being unreliable...so I bought this switch because the price was attractive. But I deeply regret my purchase now. Its been less than 2 months and the switch just died. No connection to any ethernet port...without any ethernet cable plugged into the switch, the link lights stay on at random, which indicates that its stuck in some sort of weird fault condition...and there is absolutely no way to reset it (no reset button). In this time when people are working from home, you need reliability in your networking products and netgear has proven to be trash.
customer_reviews.author: KT-amazon

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for 90 days then died.
customer_reviews.text: Worked as expected for 90 days then stopped working. Tech and customer support are none existent. If you get through to Netgear, you get transferred to multiple people none of which try to solve the problem or create an RMA. Registered the product to get "faster priority service" and this did not help. Wasted a day. This appears to be a strategy to avoid warranty replacements . The warranty is stated as 3 years but I think the 3 years is how long it may take to get an RMA.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis P.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality switch with metal housing
customer_reviews.text: I've always leaned on Netgear for home / small office switches. They have metal housings which are tough and I've never experienced situations where I need to reset them. I hit 1.0 Gbps using an internet speed test (Fast.com) through this switch, connected about 200' from my main internet router. Large file transfers across the LAN hit an average of 100 MB/sec. with jumbo packets enabled.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonFan

customer_reviews.title: Plug it in and go, no fooling around.
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a similar 5-port switch that wasn't broken, we just needed a couple more ports. The only minor annoyance was that it has no status lights on the front, only a power-on LED. No big deal, I turned it around so I could see the activity lights next to each cable connector. We use this switch for streaming video, running backups onto a home server and general 'Net surfing. We haven't managed to choke it, nor does it get hot with heavy network traffic. As an unmanaged switch should be, there is no setup needed, just plug and play.
customer_reviews.author: Jim in CT

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable at all, 2 out of 3 failed within a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: Bought three and after a few days, one of them completely stops all network traffic. All the lights are still blinking but nothing is getting through it. Everything works once I power cycle it. I get a replacement from amazon and hope it's just a one time thing. A week later, the same thing happens to another switch and needs the same power cycle fix. Bad product or bad batch? No idea but I've never had any switches fail until I got these. Sending them all back and getting switches from another brand.
customer_reviews.author: R. Yung

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware.  The reliability is suspect.
customer_reviews.text: This product worked well until it didn't. The Netgear GS316 was delivered (Amazon Prime) on May 6, 2018. It worked well and attracted no attention until it failed last night, October, 3 2018. The device looked of high quality but it just did not last. In addition, the end of support date has passed. I paid $54.99 but now its $69.99. Maybe the additional cost is for some added reliability but I doubt it. I just ordered 2x 8-port TP-Link switches to replace it. I've used them in the past with success. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Unmanaged 8-Port Switch (GS308v3)
customer_reviews.text: I use the GS308v3 switch to tie multiple segments of my network together. Network covers 3 large buildings with four separate routers/APs. I want to go to a managed switch, but for now...I will make do with this nice unmanaged switch. PROs: 1) Metal case construction 2) RELIABLE switch 3) 8-Port 4) Plug and Play 5) PRICE! CONs: 1) unmanaged / no remote monitoring or configuring 2) ??? yeah, unmanaged is all I have issue with...Great device for simple use. I have used many brands of switches and I always seem to come back to Netgear (switches only). * Would I buy again? YES * Would I recommend to a friend? YES
customer_reviews.author: F. D. Krebs

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product - Dead in Two days
customer_reviews.text: Died within few days. Metal surface becomes hot/warm to the touch, then it went dead within few days. Purchased TWO and both died in three days. Netgear Technical support non existence and at the end they ask you to work with Amazon. So I returned them both.
customer_reviews.author: Fadi E. Rahal

customer_reviews.title: Wired is better than wireless.
customer_reviews.text: Sure, wireless is convenient, but wired is so much more reliable, faster, and more stable with more devices added. My TP link router was struggling and dropping devices after 10+ wireless devices connected. This one went in my office, and allowed me to connect my personal computer, work machine, work laptop, and network printer to help bring down the number of connected wireless devices.
customer_reviews.author: Kubli

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup - plug in and go - works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: I used a 5-port Switch before and I needed to expanded to an 8-port Switch for additional Ethernet connections. Took it out of the box, plugged in the power, plugged in all Ethernet cables, THATS IT! No setup or software needed. Couldn’t be any simpler. These are the devices that I plugged into my 8-port switch: - Input signal from eero Pro mesh router - TV - Desktop PC - PS4 - Samsung SmartThings HUB - Philips HUE Smart HUB - Security Camera All devices work perfectly and internet speeds are fast. I have cable internet service and the speeds I get through the switch for my ISP is: - 152.51 Mbps download - 10.53 Mbps upload
customer_reviews.author: Brian DC

customer_reviews.title: Plug and Play
customer_reviews.text: I had an older 8 port switch that was on its way out, and decided to pick up the 16 port switch. This was a great purchase at a really good price. My speed was not bad previously but since the switch was on its way out It wasn't consistent. After replacing the old one with this bad boy I am getting much fast speeds with less lag on the second floor where the old switch was. Things running on this Onkyo reciver PS4 Xbox one Two Pcs Synology DS1812+ (two ports) Smart TV Pros: - Plug and Play - Solid hardware (heavy and metal) no cheap plastics - Fast Cons - None
customer_reviews.author: Addicted_to_Amazon

customer_reviews.title: A unmanaged switch that drops packets after some time?
customer_reviews.text: Had two of these go bad for no reason at all, they are unmanaged switches and after about 1yr of use (2nd 1.5yr) they start randomly dropping packets. Re-Wired, reset routers, did all I thought till I finally tested the hub, as who would suspect an unmanaged would just stop working and drop packets. Avoid this thing as there is something very wrong with this, 1 I might understand somehow goes bad [still unmanaged so not sure how], but 2 went bad.
customer_reviews.author: DorCino

customer_reviews.title: Fast internet everywhere....!!!
customer_reviews.text: My house has always been wired with Cat5, but the switch i used to have was garbage, below garbage, it was bad. Bought this, switched it out, and now I have great wired internet all over the house. Its amazing. Love it, very easy to setup, pretty much plug and play.
customer_reviews.author: Mohsin

customer_reviews.title: great product/UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: using for computer, works great, good quality, price was great. overall happy with purchase on all levels. UPDATE/EIGHT MONTHS LATER I REALIZED IT STOPPED WORKING. It's IN A STANDARD SPOT NO SHUFFLING AROUND. I HAVE IT FOR EXTRA PC I USED WHEN NEEDED BUT NOT USED ON A REGULAR BASIS. NO SUPPORT OR RETURN AVAILABLE. NOW I HAVE TO CONTACT MAKER OF PRODUCT. I HATE BUYING THINGS THAT WORKS PART-TIME.
customer_reviews.author: josephine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for multiple devices on home entertainment setup.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a Ethernet switch to run internet access for a smart tv, Xbox, smart blu ray player, and AT&T box from one wall jack. Devices like these are better on wired connections than wireless. I like that the construction of the switch is very durable. All metal housing. Super super easy to set up. The switch is powered so you will need an outlet for power. Each port is IN/OUT so the line from the wall can be plugged in to either of the five ports. Netgear is the standard for this kindof equipment. I purchased the five port model but if you have more devices they manufacture an eight port. I highly recommended these switches.
customer_reviews.author: K. Saboda

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I put in Cat6a and a 10g switch in my home to wire up my kids bedrooms, mine, and our media room with high speed connectivity. Only a couple of my machines are actually 10g capable though. To keep complication to a minimum, I only had one connection wired to my kids rooms and got these smaller gigabit routers to turn their 1 connection into 4 (+1 for internet in) to run their computers, smart tvs, game consoles, etc. Also used it in my home theater for the smart tv, 4k player, game console, and audio receiver. For the price, these little switches are as easy to use (plug N play more or less) as they are well made.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Hall

customer_reviews.title: Terrible speeds; performs worse than my 8 yr old $60 router.
customer_reviews.text: I can't even say you get what you pay for, because this thing basically doesn't work. Prior to this "upgrade" I was using an 8 yr old router that cost $60 back in 2020. The old router gets me wired speeds upwards of 65mbps. This new piece of junk barely gets me over 1.5mbps. THIS IS TOTAL GARBAGE, just spend like $60 and get a wifi router with multiple ports.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: A great silent N-baseT switch that needs a few more high speed ports
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these switches in my home theater room for a little over a year and can vouch it's a great switch. It is completely fanless and thus silent, the way any switch for home use should be. No issues with Aquantia AQN-107 10 Gbps cards, and works fine with 9 KB jumbo frames. It's unmanaged but works perfectly for my needs. I wish it had just a few more 10 Gbps ports. I just ordered one more for my master bedroom which also has an HTPC. Now just need to run new CAT6A or higher cable over there, and one more NIC for it also.
customer_reviews.author: Julien Pierre

customer_reviews.title: Just works.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 16-port GS316 over 9 months ago. It's worked so flawlessly I haven't had a reason to look up my order until now when I was curious about seeing if it has bandwidth-limiting capability (it does not; I guess that's what the "unmanaged" aspect is). It does what I expected it to: allow me to connect up to 15 devices to a single cable modem so all 15 devices can connect through the fast gigabit connection instead of wireless. I don't know what all these other negative reviews are going on about. ^_^;;
customer_reviews.author: A0A2 95AB DC34 69C9

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I’m very happy with this switch, it’s well made and reasonably priced. The 8 ports are more than enough for most home setups. My only complaint was the instructions were awful and that’s why I deducted one star. I had to call customer service to clarify something and the hold time was extremely long. That said once I got my answer it’s been smooth sailing. I would recommend this product to anyone who needs additional Ethernet ports.
customer_reviews.author: Double Deuce

customer_reviews.title: It's just a switch . . . never had one fail
customer_reviews.text: I have not bought Netgear before partly because other brands typically are cheaper and most Netgear switches have the network cables on the "front" side and power on the back. I prefer just the activity lights on the front and all connections on the back. I later figured out that a kitten had chewed on my network cables and the Trendnet switch that I replaced with this switch wasn't bad after all. The cables had checked out with a cable checker but after I replaced the cables the problem disappeared - So I threw away a perfectly good 16 port Trendnet switch.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: Simple installation, works as advertised, reliable, and inexpensive... what’s not to like!!
customer_reviews.text: For in home use, this switch is great!! I had (actually I still have it) an 8 port version of this Netgear unmanaged gigabit switch for just over one year. It worked so well that I slowly kept adding to my network... and I recently upgraded to a 16 port Netgear gigabit switch to accommodate the growth. These are plug and play - you just plug them in and they work. The status indicators show network activity and the newer unit has multiple LEDs per port to show whether there is 10mb, 100mb or 1gb traffic on that port. The power requirements are low and with 2 included screws, it’s easily wall mounted. I highly recommend this switch.
customer_reviews.author: dennis13409

customer_reviews.title: Reliable piece of hardware from a reputable networking company
customer_reviews.text: I bought this 16-port switch to go with an Orbi mesh wi-fi setup. Since Orbi only has a single ethernet jack, I needed something that would allow me to connect my SmartThings hub, LeGrand audio system, 5 rooms of wired ethernet, wired security products, etc. At first I thought 16 ports was overkill for a home network, but once I connected everything I realized I had more wired products than I thought and I could wire things that used to be wireless so I could get a more reliable connection. This switch saved me a lot of headache and gives me a bit of room to grow. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these, and they are always solid and reliable. Some are at my router, and others are when I have multiple devices, but only one outlet in the room (like game systems). I haven't tried testing speeds of the device itself, by my network speeds always seem good. I prefer wired, if I can, and these help keep that possible. Note: Make sure to check the prices of the 8 port, if you're buying the 4 port. Every time I went to buy the 4 port, the 8 port was $2 more. Seemed a waste not to just get the 8 port, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Technically works for a good price - little flaky
customer_reviews.text: It does what its supposed to mostly. And if you don't mind restarting it once a week is pretty ok and holds 10G link quite well on its 2 ports. The 10G ports run pretty toasty temperature wise. 3 Stars because occasionally the 10G ports start dropping packets like crazy and the switch needs a power cycle(link bounce won't fix it). Once cycled its fine again. Consider how little other affordable 10G products there are on the market - this is a good deal still - but not overly impressed neither.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Kulesa

customer_reviews.title: Died after one year- Awesome Metal Switch, Minimal Heat Dissipation, No Configuration
customer_reviews.text: Update: June 2019Unit died in less than one year. Installed to distribute network connections throughout my home. Installed inside a home media enclosure in my basement and wanted a robust metal shell and without a requirement for heavy fan noise. This unit installed nicely with zero configuration of the switch. I put a temperature remote temp gauge inside my enclosure to see how much the air increased over the ambient surrounding temperature (concerned that it would not get enough air inside the enclosure). Only experienced about a 5-8degree increase in air temperature. Great switch, easy to install, and produces minimal heat (so you can place it inside a cabinet or enclosure).
customer_reviews.author: bkrhoney

customer_reviews.title: Gave me the additional ports that I needed for my router.
customer_reviews.text: I changed from a Router that had 8 LAN ports with 1 port to connect to the modem (thus, 9 ports) to a mesh setup that only had essentially 1 usable LAN port because the other port is used to connect to the modem. This switch has 5 ports, but you have to use 1 port to connect to the modem, so you have 4 additional ports. I needed to connect four devices to the router, so this switch solved the problem. I have had four devices connected to the main router in the mesh system and it has been going strong for over a month.
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: not working at all if AT&T u-verse receiver exists in the network
customer_reviews.text: I had two 5 ports switches (d-link) that worked great. I decided to consolidate, and I bought this product. I don't know the technical reason, but if u-verse receiver exists somewhere in the network, even not connect to the switch, there are interferences in the network, and the network stops to work. It took me several days of tries and errors until I found it. Went back to my old d-link routers.
customer_reviews.author: David b.k

customer_reviews.title: Great to give 10gig to laptop and NAS over CAT5e.
customer_reviews.text: Works great to extend 10gig to. Few key systems. I added a 10gig nic to my Synology NAS and got a Thunderbolt 10gig nic for my laptop. This switch does great providing 10gig even over my older cat5e copper. It is not ideal and I get errors across the link but the fact I can burst to 10gig and get 5gig consistently is amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Poulson

customer_reviews.title: Nice little unmanaged switch. Doesn't feel cheap or disappointing, and easy to mount.
customer_reviews.text: I have a few of these now. Whether it's hooking up a small network for a 3D printer farm or a Raspberry Pi project or or something else, this switch has fit the bill nicely. I have our primary router, and an old one that I've wanted to use as an access point, but I just didn't have the available ports on the primary router. This allowed me to connect my low data-rate devices like smart home hubs and other misc widgets so that I can give a primary feed from the main router to my second access point, and it's worked out great.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great way to expand home network
customer_reviews.text: We use an Eero mesh router system, however, I wanted a faster connection for our network attached storage (NAS). The Eero only has two eithernet ports and we wanted to have more so we could hardwire our NAS to our TV, media player, etc so there wouldn't be any lag when playing back videos from our NAS. This was a perfect solution and now we are able to hardwire all of our devices to one of our mesh routers.
customer_reviews.author: Wearefamilee

customer_reviews.title: There's a reason this switch is so cheap
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your time or money on this line of switches. Spend more for netgears business class products if you value your time at all. I had trouble from day one with connections flapping every couple minutes or less, or links just not coming up. I see lots of others have had problems with these switches, I regret not checking the reviews first, but I usually can trust netgear... but I guess I just never owned their cheaper consumer grade equipment before. The difference in quality seems to be staggering.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Very basic switch with a lot of ports
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my homelab as I was running out of ports on my managed switches. The configuration options are very limited and it doesn't have many advanced features that you could find on managed switches. This is a very cheap item that will give you more ports...plain and simple. I ran some iperf tests between ports and between another switch and was getting close to line rate. Ping was minimal ~1ms and maxed out the gigabit ports. No issues with the switch so far.
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Product lights up but just stopped working after 6 months use. Under warranty but the cost of shipping is half the price of the unit. I found other reviews online with the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: SRM

customer_reviews.title: Transparent
customer_reviews.text: This, and it's sister product the GS105, are nice little switches to put in front of your CAT6 runs from your router. I've had the 105 running for 3 years, and this one is a new addition. My setup is a cable modem/router with a hardline run to both a home office, which has 2 PCs and a NAS, and the family room, which has a PC and a NAS. Sustained transfers between all devices clear 100MB/s. Never had a lost connection or any kind of interference from these devices.
customer_reviews.author: Dave A

customer_reviews.title: Netgear quality as always highest priority!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a purchaser of Netgear devices for years now and have always been pleased with the quality of their products. This purchase is no exception. Over the years, I have purchased many of these 8 port switches and they have never failed to perform. An added benefit of the ProSAFE line of products is they do come with a limited lifetime warranty, should the product fail at any time. With the combination of the warranty and the reliability of the product, one cannot go wrong with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Justin B.

customer_reviews.title: worthless for gig connections
customer_reviews.text: device drops the connection to the wan randomly requiring a reboot. Reviewed support and there is no fix for the problem, the unit is just rubbish. spend your money elsewhere. I would return but the box was thrown out. I made the mistake of thinking that a simple unmanaged switch would actually do its job properly...
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Apparently, when it's in a rack gerbils power it...
customer_reviews.text: What can we say? It's an unmanaged switch and works as it should. It sort of fits in a small 6U rack, but the outlet is on the back (instead of the side where there's all this extra room), and can't be plugged in using the smaller racks. FFS, Netgear. If it's supposed to be rack mountable, and you provided the hardware to do so, then make it truly functional. We kludged it by mouting in on the lowest 1/2 bracket, but it wasn't how we wanted to implement the rack. Lesson learned, in the future we'll buy true rackmount switches instead of the desktop/rackmount 'hybrids', which they're not.
customer_reviews.author: AskAlthea

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I just got this in today, and it works fine for the most part, with one minor issue. My laptop was only getting 100 Mbps instead of 1000 on a wired connection. The switch says the light should turn yellow if it's 100. The light on my computer turned orange, but the switch was green - turned out it was a bad cable. It would have saved me some time if the light changed color like it said it was supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Netgear is the best!
customer_reviews.text: I use these all over our HOA community to route IP cameras, access points, controlled access hardware, etc between 4 midrise condo buildings and several public structures. Netgear is very reliable to withstand all of the rigors of use in non-conditioned closets, garages, attics, etc. We have a callbox kiosk made of metal that is HOT, but this switch holds up inside. Gigabit speeds keep us compatible with new hardware that is expected to communicate quickly. No one wants outages and to track down equipment issues. Netgear gets it done.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Works fine but designed poorly
customer_reviews.text: This product works fine as advertised however the power cable plugs into the opposite side as the Ethernet ports which is a poor design in my opinion. Netgear really show have designed it so that all cables plug into the same side so it sits nicely on a desk or in my case an end table which now has much less room
customer_reviews.author: Matt Truffle

customer_reviews.title: Terrible-STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.text: Addendum to original review. Horrible product and horrible customer service. Less than 8 months old and 3 ports go dead. Took days to reach customer support. Claimed only 90 day technical support and wanted me to purchase a plan to get help. I explained it’s a plug and play unmanaged switched so there is nothing to trouble shoot and that I wanted the product replaced under the 3 year warranty which she explained was only a one year warranty (even though description on amazon and box says 3 years). The cost of shipping and replacing was the cost of buying a new one. Never again will I purchase a Netgear product. STAY AWAY!
customer_reviews.author: chuck c.

customer_reviews.title: Great for entertainment ceters
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so I could connect all the gear in my entertainment center. MY wifi router only has 4 ports on it so this allows me to run one line over to my entertainment center. and then connect the AV-tuner, TV, DVD player and Game consoles all up to the internet. This makes updating all these devices so much faster and helps prevent stuttering that I some times get via having all these devices using wifi so close together
customer_reviews.author: P. Moran

customer_reviews.title: Functional, with a curious design choice
customer_reviews.text: It's a simple switch, and it works just fine. We got one to stand up another internet zone in our house, plugged the (incoming) internet into the 8th input, and the other (outgoing) cat cables into the other inputs. Works fine, good value for a little bit of money. Loses a star because either the power cable or your cat cables sticking out of the "front" of it. Another strange decision from Netgear. Why not find a way to put all the cables on one side of the switch?
customer_reviews.author: Stone

customer_reviews.title: Good price and Neatgear
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Netgear Equipment for years, I have never had a problem with customer service although the Netgear Forum responses leave a lot to be desired, they are just standard scripted answers that accomplish little to nothing, but there are enough knowledgeable people on those Forums that you can find answers to pretty much any problems. This switch was what I was looking for, it is a Netgear product and did what I expected it to do at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Soldat_1958

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I like the simplicity. Plug it in and it works reliably. I have a 4 port cable modem/routers upstairs and used one of the ports to run an ethernet cable to my basement office. Now I have hard wired in that office another computer, a NAS drive, my main laser printer and an occasional laptop. Wiring versus wifi is less taxing and more reliable of a connection. And, can be more secure if that's an issue. Glad I went with Netgear - excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Peter C. Diotte

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install—Good Quality.
customer_reviews.text: I needed this for a home security setup. Installation was easy—really like that the screw inserts on the unit’s casing have about 1/8th inch of “give” so your screws don’t have to be perfect to get a secure install. Installation took less than 5 minutes. Dead simple to use. Insert an Ethernet cable from your router and then insert Ethernet cables going to your cameras (or whatever device you may be using). Case feels well built and solid. Transfer speeds are fast enough for 2k resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Armi

customer_reviews.title: Great Connection back up to WIFI
customer_reviews.text: Our house needed to support the wireless network with wired connection. With all the data usage these days it is very helpful to have a steady connection. This hub was very easy to connect and configure (basically change the default password). Additionally I was able to add our printer on the network with very simply. The price point was excellent definitely worth the money. I did not have to contact support since this was easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Lori G

customer_reviews.title: Looks like it's used
customer_reviews.text: First, I waited almost a month for this switch and when it arrived, it looks like it's been used. There was no plastic covering over the box - just cellophane tape. The plastic bag inside had the Netgear sticker broken and it has been opened. I've ordered many of these and this is the only one that shows up as used.
customer_reviews.author: Darren J Grebe

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because our wifi has been terrible lately. I ran ethernet cables and plugged them into the Netgear ethernet switch and that was it. Worked perfectly and my boys gaming devices aren't lagging anymore. And streaming on my TV is flawless. Highly recommend recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Keelan

customer_reviews.title: Good, reliable switch
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup as long as you put the WLAN input into port 8. No additional setup or maintenance required. It works perfectly, passing the full WLAN bandwidth to the internal LAN. Port lights on the back tell you what you need to know about each port's connection. The switch is small and light, making it easy to place and secure in tight places. Customer support folks were friendly and knowledgeable. If I needed another switch, I'd buy another one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mattes

customer_reviews.title: Increased the speed of my network
customer_reviews.text: I had an older version of this switch it still worked but I was getting a lot faster modem and had such good luck with Netgear i go way back around 2006 that I thought why not just get a newer version and its a really nice switch like my old one that does still work just slower speed capabilities. This was even less expensive too, I think i paid 109 bucks for the old one in 2006. I think this switch is unmanaged but for home or small office its just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: John Steinebach

customer_reviews.title: Failed out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item as a backup. Pulled it out of the box after 7 months in storage and it was immediately failing. Connected an older TP Link switch, which is working properly. Very disappointed by the quality.
customer_reviews.author: R Clark

customer_reviews.title: Mounting the switch
customer_reviews.text: There is really no mounting bracket for the switch. I had to build a small shelf under my desk for the switch. The power plugs in from the back of the switch and I had to make the shelf wide enough for the power plugin. Also, because of the depth of the shelf, I had to buy 1-1/2' cables. I previously purchased an 8 port switch that came with a nice mounting bracket that you mount and the switch snaps into it. The power plugs from the side. I used 1' cables to connect to it. The footprint of the 16 port is about the same as my 8 port, more compact.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bidleman

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to run some more hard wired networked devices in my home. I have had zero issues with this device since I installed it and it has worked just as I needed. Highly recommend if you need some extra networking ports.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle OB

customer_reviews.title: Not quite gigabit
customer_reviews.text: I never really had any reason to believe that this didn't fully support gigabit speeds until recently (over a year after purchase). We've recently had gigabit internet installed, and I noticed that when I connect directly to the router I get 960mbps but when I connect any device through this switch the speed test never goes above 100mbps. I've tried all different ports, all different cables. I've ever bought a new main switch for the house which is gigabit and when I use this new switch instead, I get close to gigabit speeds again. I don't know if this has degraded over time or what, but whatever the reason I wouldn't recommend this to anyone anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I'm new in the ethernet world...Covid made me take the leap into the 21st Century. Bought this switch to help with our live stream at church. I'm assuming it is working like its supposed to. Couldn't beat the price....bought a second one for our home.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Meacham

customer_reviews.title: Slower Loads
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an upgrade to my previous GS305 that I purchased in 2013. So far I am not impressed. It seems that the load and lag times have gotten slower, not faster. I will give it a few more days and if it doesn't improve, I am going to try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: DRD

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a couple days and then died...really?
customer_reviews.text: It worked for a few days, and then decided to quit on me. Lights remained active, but wouldn’t pass any network traffic. Pay the extra few bucks and buy the NETGEAR GS108 switch. It has a lifetime warranty. This model has a limited warranty. I called their support and had to mail it in ($10 for shipping). They’re supposed to be mailing me a replacement. I went ahead and also bought a GS108 for piece of mind.
customer_reviews.author: R. Steel

customer_reviews.title: 5 port switch works for me with no issues
customer_reviews.text: I had an old Linksys switch that basically dies (of course, I spent too much time thinking it was the cable modem....). This seemed to be a nice options. My setup is simple with a home office and that is running an Ethernet cable directly from the modem to my switch (hub) which feeds the router for the home wifi and the VOiP Vonage phone and the two computers in my office. Works with no issues for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tobias Funke

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good solid design. Stays cool. I like that it has an on/off switch. It's not a wifi range extender or wifi router. I'm not sure why I had to answer a question about wifi to do this review. It is a small wired only gigabit ethernet switch. It's great for situations where you want to run multiple ethernet connections off of one wall plate connection. It seems to work great with me and my daughter's gaming desktops.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: This is a great unmanaged gigabit switch.
customer_reviews.text: Switches are simple. This one is inexpensive, reliable, and does its job with no whining. I use this one for the hardwired link across my house. Setup is simple - in my case, a Cat6 cable under the house. It pops up in my living room, where this switch distributes the hardwired network to my media center components. There is no loss of signal across this switch. I highly recommend this unit for those that need to expand on an available ethernet connection.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Berry

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Works so much better than the even cheaper plastic Tplink hub I had in place which wouldn’t show each device IP through my router for parental controls. It also had one port that was 10/100 and not full gigabit. This is all auto negotiated, plug and play and every port has high 10/100/1000 speeds. I can see each device plugged into it, rather than just the cable feeding it for doing custom parental controls for each of my kids smart TVs and Xbox’s. Really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Rockies

customer_reviews.title: Good switch
customer_reviews.text: Good switch, worked great right out of the box. Feature ratings misleading-this is not WIFI-It's a hard wired switch. I also didn't need tech support, it's basically being used as a "dumb" switch. Plug it in, connect the Cat 5 cables and away you go. Big improvement in speeds over WIFI. Prior I had speed tests of about 29Mbps with WIFI and got close to the 200Mbps I'm paying for with the switch. Which is expected with WIFI, but that's why I bought it for the desktop connections.
customer_reviews.author: Matt K

customer_reviews.title: A simple unmanaged switch
customer_reviews.text: I have cat5 wiring throughout the house and had two drops that have multiple devices. WiFi sometimes has signal strength issues, so I bought two of these switches to allow multiple devices to share each of them. They were easy to install (just plug them in) and have worked great. And since they're no longer limited by WiFi, the adjacent devices move large files back and forth much more quickly.
customer_reviews.author: GregT

customer_reviews.title: Great Fanless Switch
customer_reviews.text: This little 8 port switch is ideal for your home office or entertainment area where you just need to add some more hard lined devices. Its a Unmanaged switch so just plug in your connections and a power cord and away you go with solid 1GB connections. It also includes a Kensington lock area if your in a office setting that requires that. The full metal enclosure is great and will make sure the switch will survive most environments without any issues. Its also fanless and has no noise. would recommend as a breakout switch to increase your hardline connections.
customer_reviews.author: Tangent Technology

customer_reviews.title: Could not be more pleased!
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing 5-port switches for a facility over which I have responsibility, I also purchased this 8-port switch for home use to reconfigure our computer set-up in the house. All ports worked just fine, speed was excellent - what else could I want except a good price? And I got that as well. I had occasion to call tech support prior to the purchase because I'm not a "network guy," and the tech was excellent. Entirely pleased with every aspect of the transaction and equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Grits

customer_reviews.title: Great value, LEDs don't show 10/100/1000
customer_reviews.text: Works great as a gig-E switch. Amazing value for the price. Only one complaint - that the LEDs don't show 10/100/1000 status. Not even when the case on top says "green=1000, yellow=10/100". LEDs are always green, even at 100 Mbit. Flash when active.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: It just works
customer_reviews.text: The Switch runs without a hitch. It is an unmanaged switch so go in with that expectation. I purchased this switch in 2016. It has not failed me this far, grant it the expectations are really low, but that doesn't mean it shouldn't try to surpass them. Which it does. I haven't had a port failure yet. Every time I plug in a cable the cable is recognized and autonegotiated correctly. If you're looking for a solid unmanaged switch, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Langholz

customer_reviews.title: Bought while on sale, so great value
customer_reviews.text: This 16-port switch wasn't technically required for my home setup, but the sale price it was being offered at @ the time was too good to pass up. MOAR FLASHING LIGHTS! UPSIDES: Price Known brand More open gigabit Ethernet ports than what I had MEH: No PoE Not a managed switch DOWNSIDES: Took over 2 weeks to get here, c'mon USPS!
customer_reviews.author: NumberOneSon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Switch for Home Use
customer_reviews.text: I expanded my home network to 18 ports and needed to upsize my Netgear 8 Port switch. I experienced excellent service from the Netgear switch, so purchased the 16 port switch. I mounted the switch, turned it on, inserted the feed from the modem/router which also supports 4 cables , inserted 15 cables into the switch, and it has worked perfectly since. This is a great switch at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Carlisle Grandpa

customer_reviews.title: poor performance
customer_reviews.text: With 10g uplink, client plugged into 1g port pulls less than 500Mbps. Returning for refund.
customer_reviews.author: M A Zonin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent way to extend wired network connections!
customer_reviews.text: This is a basic device that is used to extend the number of physical connections/wired connection your network. Very easy install - unbox, place rubber tabs/feet (optional), plug cable from one router part to the designated port on the device (refer to provided guide), and power on. Now you can plug in up-to 15 more networked devices! The device is low profile, takes minimal space, and low power usage. Great device if you’re looking to add more wired connections to your network.
customer_reviews.author: J_Mas

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and use, light and dependable
customer_reviews.text: Nice, relatively inexpensive 24 port unmanaged switch. Easy to install, no setup, fairly light as it uses a lot of plastic instead of metal. Did talk to support when having problems registering for warranty. Responsive and helpful. The picture shows the switch mounted underneath a desk, physically on the back of the desk, in my office.
customer_reviews.author: sanslos

customer_reviews.title: Drops connection constantly. NetGear tech support is not good.
customer_reviews.text: The router started dropping connection after 6 months of use. First - once in a week, then more and more often until it became impossible to use (4-5 times a day) This stalled my home network completely. Problem solved with purchasing new router from another brand (tp-link). So my router turned out to be buggy and impossible to use. Technical support is one of the worst I have seen. After 2 calls and total 25 minutes of waiting time on the line I decided is too much for 60 USD item and gave up.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Your private workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I have used Netgear equipment for as long as I can remember, like from the early 80s and they never failed me. Small and large, managed and not all easy to use easy to install and they just work. Never had one failed on me and never changed one because of age, only because of needs. You want a workhorse that will work until you don't, get a Netgear! Honest, it will outlive you.
customer_reviews.author: Bernt Andersson

customer_reviews.title: Probably overkill for some home networks, but does the job for us.
customer_reviews.text: I could not be more pleased with this switch. We have been using this switch for several months and have had no problems what so ever. Set up was literally just plug it in and make the connections. Our home is an older home with brick walls, plaster w/ wire lathe and as a consequence , our home network is a combo of wired and wireless with wired access points/extenders. The switch handles it all with out any issues. As you can see we still have plenty of room for expansion .
customer_reviews.author: Chatty Pants

customer_reviews.title: Great little hub!
customer_reviews.text: Loaded all eight ports, it runs like a champ, delivers the whole 400MB/S internet access across Cat 6 shielded cabling, as advertised, with 1.2 GB/S transfers within the network, a little faster even than rated exactly as do the others in my network. Netgear makes great stuff, from the wireless router to the 3 Netgear hubs in my home network, the pieces run and run without thought once installed. Kudos!
customer_reviews.author: Don Cobblerone

customer_reviews.title: Manages various Ethernet speeds without limiting higher speed devices
customer_reviews.text: High quality with simple install instruction. The LED lights that indicate whether the circuit is running 100Mbps or 1GBps was very helpful in troubleshooting my Ethernet. I currently have Ethernet supplying 235Mbps to computer alongside devices that are limited to 100Mbps on this switch. The different speed limits are managed by the switch allowing the modem to stay at the higher Ethernet speed.
customer_reviews.author: Steve V

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for Money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the NETGEAR 8-Port Ethernet Switch to accompany a recently purchased Samsung UN50RU7100FXZA smart TV. This switch is, as advertised, a true "plug and play" switch, requiring no special software or configuration. In addition to the Smart TV, this switch is also linked to a laser printer, Roku, Spectrum cable box, and a backup hard drive. The ports filled up fast.
customer_reviews.author: Neil OCONNOR

customer_reviews.title: Simple plug and play.
customer_reviews.text: As advertised plug and play. Took 15 minutes start to finish. I upgraded to a smart TV in a pool cabana. (Running the hdmi cable, fiber optic cable, center speaker wire, and cat 5 cable was a bit more time consuming). While I have a WiFi extender in the pool house, I prefer a wired connection for streaming TV. This switch allowed me to hook up multiple wired devices while keeping my WiFi extender.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of the 5 port units. When I received the package and read the installation guide it stated the package contents included a "wall-mount kit" Well it did not include the kit. When I contacted Netgear, they simply said the warehouse made a mistake and that was the end of the conversation. We all can understand one mistake but, two units missing the same contents is a clear intent to mislead customers. The customer service is the worse I have experienced to date.
customer_reviews.author: Nik Mead

product_meta.title: NETGEAR 8-Port Gigabit Ethernet Unmanaged Switch (GS308) - Home Network Hub, Office Ethernet Splitter, Plug-and-Play, Fanless Metal Housing, Desktop or Wall Mount
product_meta.description: Style:8 portThe NETGEAR 8 port Gigabit unmanaged Switch provides an easy, reliable, and affordable way to expand your network connections in homes and small offices. It is plug and play and features a rugged metal case. Features also include Auto MDI/MDI, LED indicator on Each port, energy efficient technology, fan less design, auto negotiation and non blocking switching architecture.
feature_bullets: PLUG AND PLAY: Simple set up with no software to install or configuration needed
VERSATILE MOUNTING OPTIONS: Supports desktop or wall mount placement
SILENT OPERATION: The fanless design means zero added noise wherever its located, making it ideal for noise sensitive environments
PEACE OF MIND WARRANTY – Covered by an industry leading 3 year limited hardware warranty
ENERGY EFFICIENT: Designed to optimize power usage lowering its cost to operate; Most models are compliant with IEEE802.3az Energy Efficient Ethernet mode
BUILT TO LAST: Every NETGEAR Network switch is rigorously tested for reliability, quality, and performance;

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars7,787 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
